alert.note: Alert for Blanco; Burnet; Gillespie; Llano; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 7:29PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Williamson, northwestern Travis, northwestern Blanco, northeastern Gillespie, southeastern Llano and Burnet Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 728 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a developing line extending from Joppa to 7 miles southeast of Cherry Spring. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Burnet, Marble Falls, Kingsland, Bertram, Round Mountain, Buchanan Dam, Serenada, Leander, Gainesville, Granite Shoals, Horseshoe Bay, Meadowlakes, Liberty Hill, Jarrell, Florence, Highland Haven, Inks Lake State Park, Spicewood and Blowout. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Blanco; Burnet; Gillespie; Llano; Travis; Williamson
